hits.book_ref: CWWN, vol. 48, "Messages for Building Up New Believers (1)," ch. 14: The Lord's Day
hits.snippet: In The Teaching of the Twelve Apostles (one of the first books of the church in addition to the Bible, written between approximately A.D. 75 and A.D. 90, the same era as the book of Revelation), it says, “But every Lord’s day do ye gather yourselves together, and break bread, and give thanksgiving after having confessed your transgressions, that your sacrifice may be pure” (Alexander Roberts and James Donaldson, eds., The Ante-Nicene Fathers. Grand Rapids: Wm. B. Eerdmans Publishing Company, 1979. Vol. VII, p. 381). This clearly shows us that believers met together on the Lord’s Day as early as the end of the first century.
